CatDescriptText: Mr. Bob Averell, laundry worker, North Side and Mr. John Schinker, engineer, North Side, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 12, 1962, pg. 13 with question: "Do you think the Kennedy Administration is anti-big business?  Mr. Averell's answer reads: "It looks like they are, but it depends on what side you are on..."  Mr. Schinker's answer reads: "He's not against big business.  Because steel is selling so cheaply throughout the world, we had better come down on the price.  I think the President acted for the welfare of the entire country."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Bob Averell wearing fedora and diagonally striped necktie, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of John Schinker wearing light colored shirt with rolled sleeves, standing across from Canter's Pharmacy, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
